Cumulus Clouds happen when water evaporates and gets carried upward by warm air rising to meet cold air.

When there are only a few and they're white, it probably won't rain. But if they turn into big grey clouds, better get an umberlla!

Cirrus Clouds are thin and wispy and very high up in the sky.

They are made of ice crystals and are usually seen in a beautiful blue sky.
These clouds aren't bringing rain.

Your hometown didn't just get covered by a big grey blanket!
Those are Stratus Clouds.
They form when warm air passes over cold air near the ground.
And yup, galoshes today.
This is a recipe for rain.

Dark, rolling clouds spell Nimbus! They already have rain and snow falling out of them and often mean thunder.
Time to get inside!!!
